## Visualization

### Semester effect on adhd_total

```{r}
mod_1 <- lm(adhd_total ~ days_since_semester_start, data = d_try)
anova(mod_1) %>% eta_squared()

plot_a_complete <- ggplot(d_try, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = adhd_total)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "red", se = TRUE) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) + 
  labs(x = 'Days since semester starts when completed the survey', 
       y = 'Total score of 6-items ASRS', 
       title = 'Semester Effect on ADHD Total Score') +
  xlim(0, 110) +
  ylim(0, 7.0) +
  stat_cor(color = "red", size = 6) 

ggsave(plot = plot_a_complete, 
       filename = file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete.png'), 
       height = 5.5, width = 5.5,
       units = 'in')  
```


```{r echo=FALSE, out.width='80%'}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete.png'))
```


```{r}
plot_a_complete_year <- ggplot(d_try, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = adhd_total)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "red", se = TRUE) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) + 
  labs(x = 'Days since semester starts when completed the survey', 
       y = 'Total score of 6-items ASRS', 
       title = 'Semester Effect on ADHD Total Score By Year') +
  xlim(0, 110) +
  ylim(0, 6.8) +
  stat_cor(color = 'red', size = 5) +
  facet_wrap(~year)  

ggsave(plot = plot_a_complete_year, 
       filename = file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_year.png'), 
       height = 7.5, width = 10, units = 'in')
```

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width='80%'}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_year.png'))
```

quick note: we do not have data for spring-2023
```{r}
# Specify the order for semester_id
d_try$semester_id <- factor(d_try$semester_id, 
                            levels = c("Spring-2018", "Fall-2018", "Spring-2019", "Fall-2019", 
                                       "Spring-2020", "Fall-2020", "Spring-2021", "Fall-2021", 
                                       "Spring-2022", "Fall-2022", "Spring-2023", "Fall-2023"))

# Create the plot
plot_a_complete_semestereach <- ggplot(d_try, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = adhd_total)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.6, size = 2) +  
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "red", se = TRUE) + 
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) + 
  labs(x = 'Days since semester start', 
       y = 'Total score of 6-items ASRS',
       title = 'ADHD Total Scores Over Time by Semester') +
  xlim(0, 110) +
  ylim(0, 8) +
  stat_cor(color = "red") +  
  facet_wrap(~semester_id) 

ggsave(plot = plot_a_complete_semestereach, 
       filename = file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_semestereach.png'), 
       height = 7.5, width = 10, units = 'in')

```

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width='80%'}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_semestereach.png'))
```

### enrollment number
```{r}
d_try <- d_try %>%
  mutate(week = ceiling(days_since_semester_start / 7))

d_summary <- d_try %>%
  group_by(semester_id, week) %>%
  summarise(num_participants = n_distinct(participant_id))

plot_a_complete_enrollment <- ggplot(d_summary, aes(x = factor(week), y = num_participants)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "blue", alpha = 0.7) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  labs(x = 'Week', 
       y = 'Number of Participants',
       title = 'Number of Participants by Week and Semester') +
  facet_wrap(~semester_id)

ggsave(plot = plot_a_complete_enrollment, 
       filename = file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_enrollment.png'), 
       height = 6.5, width = 10, units = 'in')
```


```{r , echo=FALSE, out.width='80%'}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(figure_path, 'plot_a_complete_enrollment.png'))
```


### Semester effect on ADHD_clinical
```{r}
glm_1 <- glm(adhd_clinical ~ days_since_semester_start, family = binomial(link = "logit"), data = d_try)
```

```{r}
newdata <- with(d_try, data.frame(
  days_since_semester_start = rep(unique(days_since_semester_start))
))
newdata$prob <- predict(glm_1, newdata = newdata, type = "response")
newdata$se <- predict(glm_1, newdata = newdata, type = "link", se.fit = TRUE)$se.fit

# Plot the figure
adhd_prob <- ggplot(d_try, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = adhd_clinical)) +
  geom_point(position = position_jitter(width = 0.1, height = 0.1), alpha = 0.5) +
  stat_smooth(data = newdata, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = prob, ymin = prob - 1.96 * se, ymax = prob + 1.96 * se),
              method = "glm", method.args = list(family = "binomial"),
              se = TRUE, fullrange = TRUE, alpha = 0.2) +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Probability of being diagnosed ADHD", labels = scales::percent) +
  labs(title = "Semester Effect on Being Diagonized ADHD") +
  theme_bw() +
  stat_cor(color = 'blue', size = 5, label.x = 10, label.y = 0.8)
ggsave(plot = adhd_prob, 
       filename = file.path(figure_path, 'plot_adhd_prob.png'), 
       height = 6.5, width = 9, units = 'in')
```

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width='80%'}
knitr::include_graphics(file.path(figure_path, 'plot_adhd_prob.png'))
```

```{r}
d_graph <- data.frame(days_since_semester_start = seq(0, 110, length = 1000))
d_graph <- ggplotPredict(mod_11, d_graph)


plot_sandiamatrices_hit_complete <- ggplot(d_try, aes(x = days_since_semester_start, y = sandia_matrices_hit_rate)) +
  geom_jitter() +
  geom_smooth(data = d_graph, aes(ymin = CILo, ymax = CIHi, x = days_since_semester_start, y =Predicted),
              stat = "identity", color="red") +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) + 
  labs(x = 'Days since semester starts when completed the survey', y = 'Sandia Matrices Hit Rate') +
  xlim(0,110)+
  ylim(0, 1) +
  stat_cor()
plot_sandiamatrices_hit_complete
```
